result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (6th) and OWI (6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (6th) and the other charge, OWI (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John C. Waite was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and may not be present upon the premises of any bars.
Defendant to comply with any further terms and/or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Case called @ 9:12 a.m. Defendant John C. Waite in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Defendant John C. Waite in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have reached an agreement. The parties agree waive the right to a having a PSI prepared.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - Dismissed outright. Cts 3 & 4 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Zilles. Statement by the defendant. 

Court orders: 60 month term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 30 mos IC/30 mos ES - concurrent with the sentence currently being served in 10CF217 - 176 days CFTS. ES Conditions:  AODA and follow through, Abs Sob, Not be on the premises of any bars, defendant to maintain gainful employment, 36 mos DL rev/ 36 mos IID, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, OWI Assessment, $2500 fine inclusive of costs - Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is not eligible for CIP Defendant is eligible for SAP. Appeal rights given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

10CF-217 and 14CF-6 - Both Cases Called @ 11:24 AM: Defendant John C. Waite in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Zilles, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per DA:  It does not believe that both cases will be resolved today.  SEHR to proceed as to 10CF-217.  Atty Zilles concurs.  Court adjourns 14CF-6 for further STC.  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Order Packet.  No materials errors noted.  Counsel and Court agree with 426 days TS credit - stipulated.  Court grants 426 days TS credit.  Argument by DA.  Argument by Atty Zilles.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:   4 yrs bifurcated SEH - 2 yrs IC/2 yrs ES with TS credit of 426 days.  Conditions of ES:  Ab Sobriety with RX prohibition also; Bar Prohibition; Costs of $1510 reimposed as a condition of ES, civil judgment if not paid at the conclusion of ES; No alcohol at any premises that Def stays or resides upon release - absolutely no alcohol at that location; Follow all recommendations of the supervising agent; Eligible for ERP/Not Eligible for CIP - sentence would be consecutive to any other sentence currently serving.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Case Called @ 9:30 AM:  Defendant John C. Waite in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Suppression Motion to go forward.  Deputy Scott Eagan sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA Blader.  Scope of the motion confirmed by Defense counsel.  Ex No 1 marked - Sally Port Photo of Def - Entered and Received.  Ex No 2 marked - Squad Video of Event - Entered and Received.  Entered and Received.  Cross Exam by Atty Zilles.  State is prepared to Stipulate to the premise of the stop.  Response by Atty Zilles.  Testimony continued.  Redirect by DA Blader:  Record to reflect positive ID of Defendant by witness.  Re-Cross by Atty Zilles.  Ex No 3 marked - WI DL of Dorothy Waite - Entered and Received. Argument by DA.  Argument by Atty Zilles.  Off Record for Court to view video.  Back of Record @ 10:32 AM.  The Court:  Case law reconciled - 2 cases recited and reconciliations stated.  Court denies motion for suppression at this time.  Atty Zilles hopeful that both cases will be resolved together.  DA has no objection to continue to track both cases together - 10CF217 ad 14CF6.  Counsel are not anticipating an Order for PSI.  SEHR and P/S to be scheduled.  If both matters will not go forward together, Court to be advised in advance of hearing.  Atty Zilles argues for bond as to 10CF217 and implementation of new bond.  Maintains that DOC no longer has the jurisdiction.  Based upon 2 felony matters pending, Court will not consider establishing a new bond and believes that the issue is with DOC as to release on SEHR case.  Court denies request for bond.

Case Called 11:45 AM: Defendant John C. Waite in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Zilles, both appearing in person.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge appeared via video from Green Lake Co.  Receipt of INFO admitted and reading waived.  NGP received and entered.  INFO stated by the Court.  Court suggests a STC be scheduled within 30 days.  Counsel to discuss if any potential motions forthcoming.  Per DA:  Due to pending SEHR as to 10CF-217, DA suggests dual assignment as there will be a global resolution for both matters.  No objection by Atty Zilles to special assignment of Rev case to keep both cases together at sentencing.  Court advises judicial assignment to be submitted for 10CF-217.   P/S may be over-anxious should motions be filed by defense, may be simply a STC for further scheduling purposes. Court will want to keep the cases moving along.  At the next STC, Atty Zilles to advise if any motions will be filed.
Arraignment on March 6, 2014 at 10:30 am.
